Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York Board of Fire Underwriters and its Board of Directors to reconsider the decisions to discontinue funding the Fire Patrol at the end of the year and cease Fire Patrol operations on October 15, 2006 and asking the Mayor and the Commissioner of the New York City Fire Department to join the Council in urging them to reconsider these decisions and delay implementing their plans to discontinue the operations of the Fire Patrol until the end of 2006.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: NY Board of Fire Underwriters and its Board of Directors to reconsider the decisions to discontinue funding the Fire Patrol at the end of the year and cease Fire Patrol operations on October 15, 2006.

Items.Title:
Resolution approving an Amended Urban Development Action Area Project located at 134, 138, 142, 148 and 152 West 143rd Street (Block 2011/Lot 52), Manhattan, pursuant to Section 694 of the General Municipal Law (L.U. No. 289; 20075088 HAM).
body

By Council Members Katz and Garodnick

WHEREAS, the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development ("HPD") submitted to the Council on September 13, 2006 its request dated August 21, 2006 that the Council take the following actions regarding an Urban Development Action Area Project (the "Project") located at 134, 138, 142, 148 and 152 West 143rd Street (Block 2011/Lot 52), Community District 10, Borough of Manhattan (the "Project"):

	Approve an amendment to the Project pursuant to Section 694 of the General Municipal Law.

      	WHEREAS, on October 25, 1984, pursuant to Article 16 of the General Municipal Law, the Board of Estimate approved the Project, the Area Designation, waived the requirements of Section 197-c of the New York City Charter and found the Project was consistent with Section 691 of the New York City Charter (Exhibit A, a copy of which is attached hereto);

WHEREAS, upon due notice, the Council held a public hearing on the amendment to the Project on October 3, 2006;

WHEREAS, the Council has considered the land use implications and other policy issues relating to the Project;

RESOLVED:

The Council approves the Amended Project as an urban development action area project pursuant to Section 694 of the General Municipal Law.

The Project shall be disposed of and developed upon the terms and conditions in the Project Summary that HPD has submitted to the Council, a copy of which is attached hereto.




Adopted.


Office of the City Clerk, }
The City of New York,  } ss.:

      	   	I hereby certify that the foregoing is a true copy of a Resolution passed by The Council of The City of New York on October 11, 2006, on file in this office.





………………………………….
   		City Clerk, Clerk of The Council
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 289 - UDAAP, 134, 138, 142, 148 and 152 W. 143rd St., Manhattan (20075088HAM)

Items.Title:
Resolution approving an Amended Urban Development Action Area Project located at 134, 138, 142, 148 and 152 West 143rd Street (Block 2011/Lot 52), Manhattan, pursuant to Section 694 of the General Municipal Law (L.U. No. 289; 20075088 HAM).
body

By Council Members Katz and Garodnick

WHEREAS, the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development ("HPD") submitted to the Council on September 13, 2006 its request dated August 21, 2006 that the Council take the following actions regarding an Urban Development Action Area Project (the "Project") located at 134, 138, 142, 148 and 152 West 143rd Street (Block 2011/Lot 52), Community District 10, Borough of Manhattan (the "Project"):

	Approve an amendment to the Project pursuant to Section 694 of the General Municipal Law.

      	WHEREAS, on October 25, 1984, pursuant to Article 16 of the General Municipal Law, the Board of Estimate approved the Project, the Area Designation, waived the requirements of Section 197-c of the New York City Charter and found the Project was consistent with Section 691 of the New York City Charter (Exhibit A, a copy of which is attached hereto);

WHEREAS, upon due notice, the Council held a public hearing on the amendment to the Project on October 3, 2006;

WHEREAS, the Council has considered the land use implications and other policy issues relating to the Project;

RESOLVED:

The Council approves the Amended Project as an urban development action area project pursuant to Section 694 of the General Municipal Law.

The Project shall be disposed of and developed upon the terms and conditions in the Project Summary that HPD has submitted to the Council, a copy of which is attached hereto.




Adopted.


Office of the City Clerk, }
The City of New York,  } ss.:

      	   	I hereby certify that the foregoing is a true copy of a Resolution passed by The Council of The City of New York on October 11, 2006, on file in this office.





………………………………….
   		City Clerk, Clerk of The Council

Items.MinutesNote:
At his point, the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) asked for a Moment of Silence for the following individuals:

Army Sgt. Mario Nelson, 26, of Canarsie, Brooklyn, who died on October 1, 2006 in Hit, Iraq from injuries suffered when a rocket propelled grenade denoted near his vehicle.
Sgt. Nelson was assigned to the 1st Battalion 36th Infrantry Regiment, 1st Brigade Combat
Team,1st Armored Division based in Friedberg, Germany.  He is survived by his wife Mecca, his 3 year old daughter Mia, as well as parents and siblings.

Mr. Domenic F, Recchia, father of Council Member Domenic M. Recchia, Jr,  passed away on October 6, 2006.  He leaves behind his wife, 4 children, 7 grandchildren and 1 great-grandchild.

Nellie Ashby, great-grandmother of Council ember Eric Martin Dilan, who died last week at the age of 93.
